intro: Oryzopsis barbellata, commonly known as the bearded grass, is a perennial grass species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and dense, tufted inflorescences that bear small, spikelet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Oryzopsis barbellata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
